articles.title: Los Alamos National Laboratory Announces Details Of Supercomputer Collaboration With Nvidia
articles.summary: Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL) announced new details of its supercomputer collaboration with Nvidia and HPE, resulting in the "Venado" system. Venado will be the first U.S. customer to receive an Nvidia Grace central processing unit and will utilize a balanced architecture optimized for diverse scientific research, from materials science to power-grid modeling. It represents a significant step in developing a robust software ecosystem and leadership-class computing capabilities for the Laboratory, with delivery expected in 2023.

articles.title: Nvidia TAO Toolkit update aims to simplify deep learning model development
articles.summary: Nvidia has updated its TAO Toolkit platform to simplify and accelerate deep learning model creation for enterprise applications, making AI development more accessible and less time-consuming. The toolkit now includes new capabilities like "bring your own model weights" and integration with TensorBoard for better visualization, along with the option to deploy as-a-service with REST APIs. While other companies have also worked on simplifying AI pipelines, analysts note that Nvidia's TAO Toolkit, with its low-code nature and pre-trained models, aims to speed up time-to-market for AI models and reduce the need for extensive data science expertise.

articles.title: 6 High-Quality, Undervalued Semiconductor Stocks
articles.summary: Semiconductor stocks have seen significant declines in 2022, creating a strong buying opportunity for long-term investors. Morningstar analysts highlight several high-quality, undervalued semiconductor companies with strong competitive advantages, benefiting from attractive valuations and a long-term demand surge for chips across various industries. The article discusses when the chip shortage might end and the positive long-term outlook for the sector despite potential short-term slowdowns.

articles.title: Is the Roundhill Ball Metaverse ETF (METV) Right for You?
articles.summary: The Roundhill Ball Metaverse ETF (METV) offers investors diversified exposure to companies benefiting from the metaverse's growth. This article examines METV's top holdings, including Meta Platforms, Nvidia, Roblox, Microsoft, and Autodesk, highlighting their roles in the metaverse ecosystem. It also discusses the fund's expense ratio and the potential market size of the metaverse industry.

articles.title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) Announces the 12 Winners of its 8th Accelerator Program
articles.summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) has announced the 12 winners of its 8th accelerator program, selected from around 50 companies. This program, launched in 2014, provides one year of personalized support, including mentorship from senior HPE managers and access to HPE's ecosystem, for young innovative French companies. The selected companies are primarily focused on responsible digital, artificial intelligence (especially for industry 4.0), health, and cybersecurity.

articles.title: Fortinet (FTNT) to Split Stock in 5 to Attract More Investors
articles.summary: Fortinet (FTNT) announced a five-for-one forward stock split to make its shares more accessible to employees and retail investors, with stockholder approval scheduled for June 17. If approved, the stock price will drop from approximately $300 to $60 per share. This move follows similar stock splits by other major tech companies like Alphabet, Amazon, and NVIDIA, aiming to boost demand and potentially increase share prices.
